I.  THE ENSUING PROJECT 
1.  The  ensuing  project  will  be  aligned  with  the  following  impact:  competitiveness  and 
sustainability of Mongolia’s agriculture sector improved.1 The outcome of the ensuing project will 
be  value  addition  on  Mongolian  agricultural  resources  increased  by  project  participating 
enterprises (PPE).2 The project is expected to enhance technology adoption of agro-enterprise, 
to  increase  primarily  the  agro-processing  capacity  and  secondly  agricultural  production  in 
Mongolia, and hence increase value addition to agricultural resources. The increased capacity 
will  lead  to  employment  generation,  and  indirectly  benefit  herders,  farmers,  and  primary 
processors through the PPEs’ increased demand for raw materials. An indicative financing 
amount of $19.9 million from regular ordinary capital resources and $37.2 million of concessional 
ordinary capital resources has been proposed for the ensuing project. The Government of 
Mongolia, during the country programming mission held in Ulaanbaatar in June 2021, requested 
the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to provide lending support to prepare the Agriculture and 
Rural Development Project Phase 2. The ensuing loan is included in ADB’s lending pipeline 
discussed with the Government of Mongolia during the country programming mission held from 
December 2020 to March 2021. 
II.  THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
 
A.  Justification 
2.  The executing agency, the Ministry of Food, Agriculture, and Light Industry (MOFALI), has 
limited  experience  with  ADB  requirements  for  loan  preparation.  The  transaction  technical 
assistance (TA) will help the government prepare a project design that complies with the ADB 
requirements and international best practices.3 The TA will undertake the relevant work, tasks, 
and due diligence for assessing both the technical, economic, and financial feasibility of the 
project, as well as the environmental and social impacts of the project.

4.  Project innovations are delivered through supporting stronger financial institutions to 
deliver financing for sustainable and resilient agricultural and food systems that build stronger and 
safer rural  economies.  ADB  will  apply  a  One-ADB  approach  cooperating  with  Sustainable 
Development and Climate Change Department to find examples of best practices in developing 
member countries, and with Private Sector Operations Department to explore private sector 
linkages for agribusiness for value chain development. 
C.  Cost and Financing 
 
5.  The TA is estimated to cost $670,000 of which $500,000 will be financed on a grant basis 
by ADB’s Technical Assistance Special Fund (TASF 7) and $100,000 will be financed on a grant 
basis by ADB’s TASF 6. The key expenditure items are listed in Appendix 1. 
 
6.  The government will provide counterpart support in the form of counterpart staff, data 
collection, logistic support in arranging workshops and field visits, and other in-kind contributions. 
The government was informed that approval of the TA does not commit ADB to finance any 
ensuing project. 
 
D.  Implementation Arrangements 
 
7.  ADB through the Environment, Natural Resources, and Agriculture Division of ADB’s East 
Asia Department will administer and coordinate the implementation of the TA. A multisector 
steering committee, chaired by the MOFALI State Secretary, including representatives from 
central agencies and the Mongolian Chamber of Commerce, will guide the project. A project 
implementation unit will be established at MOFALI to coordinate and implement the project. The 
TA will be implemented over 12 months, from November 2021 to October 2022. Equipment for 
the TA consultants will be procured following ADB Procurement Policy (2017, as amended from 
time to time), and its associated staff instructions. Disbursement under the TA will be in line with 
ADB’s Technical Assistance Disbursement Handbook (2020, as amended from time to time). 
MOFALI will provide office space for consultants for the TA.
